result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Frank H Fay

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Rick David Steinberg called the Court at 8:30 a.m. informing the Court he is unable to pass the Milwaukee County health protocol screening and requests an adjournment. Defense counsel informed the Court he is in good communication with his defendant and will relay the next court date. Court grants request and reschedules the Pretrial Conference to 12/1/2022 at 8:30 a.m. Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with VA Medical Center, MH Veterans Justice Outreach, KAW

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 10/09/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST. 
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Frank H Fay in court.  Attorney Rick David Steinberg in court for Frank H Fay.  Student Intern Madeline Witte under the supervision of prosecuting attorney Thomas L. Potter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Reserve, Branch 13.  Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 093290,
Payable Number: 1035972,
Receipt Number: 22RP039379,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 10/7/22 @ 1:30p
